scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 7 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
sole, ad, der, ly, songs, sus, c, vice, al, catch, el, con, horse, pect

## Clues
A. ___ ___ — Relation hint: Category: church officer — : older, greater than another in age or seniority.
B. ___ — Relation hint: Synonym: knight — a chessman shaped to resemble the head of a [masked]; can move two squares horizontally and one vertically (or vice versa)
C. ___ ___ — Relation hint: Related form: consolation — an ornamental scroll-shaped bracket (especially one used to support a wall fixture)
D. ___ ___ — Relation hint: Topic domain: noun.communication — Counseling to perform a specific illegal act.
E. ___ ___ — Relation hint: Category: guess — To have suspicion.
F. ___ — Relation hint: Can be used as noun or verb — the act of apprehending (especially apprehending a criminal)
G. ___ ___ — Relation hint: Contains double 'l' — a friendly nation

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
